title: Data Science
text:
What do you think being a data scientist is about?

It seems like the definition of a data scientist isn’t standardized, an idea I noticed both in Indeed job postings and also in the readings we were assigned this week. Ultimately, they help draw conclusions using data. They often have training or educational credentials beyond the undergraduate level, but usually not a PhD.

What differences/similarities do you see between data scientists and statisticians?




Characteristic/Skill
Statistician
Data Scientist




SQL
[ ]
[x]




How do you view yourself in relation to these two areas?

I am somewhere in between and am faking it until I make it.

title: Data Science
text:
Running Code
Density function for Petal Width from the Iris data set

y <- density(iris$Petal.Width)

Further information about this R object

class(y)

[1] "density"

typeof(y)

[1] "list"

structure(y)


Call:
    density.default(x = iris$Petal.Width)

Data: iris$Petal.Width (150 obs.);  Bandwidth 'bw' = 0.2518

       x                 y            
 Min.   :-0.6555   Min.   :0.0005272  
 1st Qu.: 0.3222   1st Qu.:0.0832811  
 Median : 1.3000   Median :0.2653324  
 Mean   : 1.3000   Mean   :0.2554014  
 3rd Qu.: 2.2778   3rd Qu.:0.4193541  
 Max.   : 3.2555   Max.   :0.4978541  


Here’s a plot









The echo: false option disables the printing of code (only output is displayed).
